oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Three brass Civil War spurs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three brass Civil War era spurs. The top spur was found near Readyville, Tenn. and is standard US Army issue. The middle spur is likely of Confederate manufacture and was recovered near Nickajack Creek, Tenn. The bottom spur is a civilian design but was possibly used by Confederate troops. It was recovered from Cannon County, Tenn.
